pageContent: English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (Part 16)

Credits English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (16 Raag Todee) by Dr. Sant Singh Khalsa Downloaded in HTML format from www.gurbanifiles.com Converted by webmaster@ishwar.com For more sacred texts, please visit: www.ishwar.com 1

Raag Todee − Part 001 711 : 1 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 711 : 2 Raag Todee, Chau−Padas, Fourth Mehl, First House: 711 : 3 Without the Lord, my mind cannot survive. 711 : 4 If the Guru unites me with my Beloved Lord God, my breath of life, then I shall not have to face the wheel of reincarnation again in the terrifying world−ocean. ||1||Pause|| 711 : 5 My heart is gripped by a yearning for my Lord God, and with my eyes, I behold my Lord God. 711 : 6 The merciful True Guru has implanted the Name of the Lord within me; this is the Path leading to my Lord God. ||1|| 711 : 7 Through the Lord's Love, I have found the Naam, the Name of my Lord God, the Lord of the Universe, the Lord my God. 711 : 8 The Lord seems so very sweet to my heart, mind and body; upon my face, upon my forehead, my good destiny is inscribed. ||2|| 2

711 : 9 Those whose minds are attached to greed and corruption forget the Lord, the good Lord God. 711 : 10 Those self−willed manmukhs are called foolish and ignorant; misfortune and bad destiny are written on their foreheads. ||3|| 711 : 11 From the True Guru, I have obtained a discriminating intellect; the Guru has revealed the spiritual wisdom of God. 711 : 12 Servant Nanak has obtained the Naam from the Guru; such is the destiny inscribed upon his forehead. ||4||1|| 711 : 13 Todee, Fifth Mehl, First House, Du−Padas: 711 : 14 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 711 : 15 The Saints do not know any other. 711 : 16 They are carefree, ever in the Lord's Love; the Lord and Master is on their side. ||Pause|| 711 : 17 Your canopy is so high, O Lord and Master; no one else has any power. Raag Todee − Part 001 3

711 : 18 Such is the immortal Lord and Master the devotees have found; the spiritually wise remain absorbed in His Love. ||1|| 711 : 19 Disease, sorrow, pain, old age and death do not even approach the humble servant of the Lord. 711 : 20 They remain fearless, in the Love of the One Lord; O Nanak, they have surrendered their minds to the Lord. ||2||1|| 711 : 21 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 711 : 22 Forgetting the Lord, one is ruined forever. 711 : 23 How can anyone be deceived, who has Your Support, O Lord? ||Pause|| −− Raag Todee − Part 001 −− Raag Todee − Part 001 4

Raag Todee − Part 002 712 : 24 Without meditating in remembrance on the Lord, life is like a burning fire, even if one lives long, like a snake. 712 : 25 One may rule over the nine regions of the earth, but in the end, he shall have to depart, losing the game of life. ||1|| 712 : 26 He alone sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord, the treasure of virtue, upon whom the Lord showers His Grace. 712 : 27 He is at peace, and his birth is blessed; Nanak is a sacrifice to him. ||2||2|| 712 : 28 Todee, Fifth Mehl, Second House, Chau−Padas: 712 : 29 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 712 : 30 The mind wanders, wandering in the ten directions. 712 : 31 It is intoxicated by Maya, enticed by the taste of greed. God Himself has deluded it. ||Pause|| 712 : 32 5

He does not focus his mind, even for a moment, on the Lord's sermon, or the Lord's Praises, or the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy. 712 : 33 He is excited, gazing on the transitory color of the safflower, and looking at other men's wives. ||1|| 712 : 34 He does not love the Lord's lotus feet, and he does not please the True Lord. 712 : 35 He runs around chasing the fleeting objects of the world, in all directions, like the ox around the oil press. ||2|| 712 : 36 He does not practice the Naam, the Name of the Lord; nor does he practice charity or inner cleansing. 712 : 37 He does not sing the Kirtan of the Lord's Praises, even for an instant. Clinging to his many falsehoods, he does not please his own mind, and he does not understand his own self. ||3|| 712 : 38 He never does good deeds for others; he does not serve or meditate on the True Guru. 712 : 39 He is entangled in the company and the advice of the five demons, intoxicated by the wine of Maya. ||4|| 712 : 40 I offer my prayer in the Saadh Sangat; hearing that the Lord is the Lover of His devotees, I have come. Raag Todee − Part 002 6

712 : 41 Nanak runs after the Lord, and pleads, "Protect my honor, Lord, and make me Your own."||5||1||3|| 712 : 42 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 712 : 43 Without understanding, his coming into the world is useless. 712 : 44 He puts on various ornaments and many decorations, but it is like dressing a corpse. ||Pause|| 712 : 45 With great effort and exertion, the miser works to gather in the riches of Maya. 712 : 46 He does not give anything in charity or generosity, and he does not serve the Saints; his wealth does not do him any good at all. ||1|| 712 : 47 The soul−bride puts on her ornaments, embellishes her bed, and fashions decorations. 712 : 48 But if she does not obtain the company of her Husband Lord, the sight of these decorations only brings her pain. ||2|| 712 : 49 The man works all day long, threshing the husks with the pestle. Raag Todee − Part 002 7

712 : 50 He is depressed, like a forced laborer, and so he is of no use to his own home. ||3|| 712 : 51 But when God shows His Mercy and Grace, He implants the Naam, the Name of the Lord, within the heart. 712 : 52 Search the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, O Nanak, and find the sublime essence of the Lord. ||4||2||4|| 712 : 53 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 712 : 54 O Lord, ocean of mercy, please abide forever in my heart. 712 : 55 Please awaken such understanding within me, that I may be in love with You, God. ||Pause|| 712 : 56 Please, bless me with the dust of the feet of Your slaves; I touch it to my forehead. 712 : 57 I was a great sinner, but I have been made pure, singing the Kirtan of the Lord's Glorious Praises. ||1|| −− Raag Todee − Part 002 −− Raag Todee − Part 002 8

Raag Todee − Part 003 713 : 58 Your Will seems so sweet to me; whatever You do, is pleasing to me. 713 : 59 Whatever You give me, with that I am satisfied; I shall chase after no one else. ||2|| 713 : 60 I know that my Lord and Master God is always with me; I am the dust of all men's feet. 713 : 61 If I find the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, I shall obtain God. ||3|| 713 : 62 Forever and ever, I am Your child; You are my God, my King. 713 : 63 Nanak is Your child; You are my mother and father; please, give me Your Name, like milk in my mouth. ||4||3||5|| 713 : 64 Todee, Fifth Mehl, Second House, Du−Padas: 713 : 65 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 713 : 66 I beg for the Gift of Your Name, O my Lord and Master. 9

713 : 67 Nothing else shall go along with me in the end; by Your Grace, please allow me to sing Your Glorious Praises. ||1||Pause|| 713 : 68 Power, wealth, various pleasures and enjoyments, all are just like the shadow of a tree. 713 : 69 He runs, runs, runs around in many directions, but all of his pursuits are useless. ||1|| 713 : 70 Except for the Lord of the Universe, everything he desires appears transitory. 713 : 71 Says Nanak, I beg for the dust of the feet of the Saints, so that my mind may find peace and tranquility. ||2||1||6|| 713 : 72 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 713 : 73 The Naam, the Name of the Dear Lord, is the Support of my mind. 713 : 74 It is my life, my breath of life, my peace of mind; for me, it is an article of daily use. ||1||Pause|| 713 : 75 The Naam is my social status, the Naam is my honor; the Naam is my family. 713 : 76 Raag Todee − Part 003 10

The Naam is my companion; it is always with me. The Lord's Name is my emancipation. ||1|| 713 : 77 Sensual pleasures are talked about a lot, but none of them goes along with anyone in the end. 713 : 78 The Naam is Nanak's dearest friend; the Lord's Name is my treasure. ||2||2||7|| 713 : 79 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 713 : 80 Sing the sublime Praises of the Lord, and your disease shall be eradicated. 713 : 81 Your face shall become radiant and bright, and your mind shall be immaculately pure. You shall be saved here and hereafter. ||1||Pause|| 713 : 82 I wash the Guru's feet and serve Him; I dedicate my mind as an offering to Him. 713 : 83 Renounce self−conceit, negativity and egotism, and accept what comes to pass. ||1|| 713 : 84 He alone commits himself to the service of the Saints, upon whose forehead such destiny is inscribed. 713 : 85 Raag Todee − Part 003 11

Says Nanak, other than the One Lord, there is not any other able to act. ||2||3||8|| 713 : 86 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 713 : 87 O True Guru, I have come to Your Sanctuary. 713 : 88 Grant me the peace and glory of the Lord's Name, and remove my anxiety. ||1||Pause|| 713 : 89 I cannot see any other place of shelter; I have grown weary, and collapsed at Your door. 713 : 90 Please ignore my account; only then may I be saved. I am worthless − please, save me! ||1|| 713 : 91 You are always forgiving, and always merciful; You give support to all. 713 : 92 Slave Nanak follows the Path of the Saints; save him, O Lord, this time. ||2||4||9|| 713 : 93 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 713 : 94 My tongue sings the Praises of the Lord of the world, the ocean of virtue. Raag Todee − Part 003 12
713 : 95 Peace, tranquility, poise and delight well up in my mind, and all sorrows run away. ||1||Pause|| −− Raag Todee − Part 003 −− Raag Todee − Part 003 13

Raag Todee − Part 004 714 : 96 Whatever I ask for, I receive; I serve at the Lord's feet, the source of nectar. 714 : 97 I am released from the bondage of birth and death, and so I cross over the terrifying world−ocean. ||1|| 714 : 98 Searching and seeking, I have come to understand the essence of reality; the slave of the Lord of the Universe is dedicated to Him. 714 : 99 If you desire eternal bliss, O Nanak, ever remember the Lord in meditation. ||2||5||10|| 714 : 100 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 714 : 101 The slanderer, by Guru's Grace, has been turned away. 714 : 102 The Supreme Lord God has become merciful; with Shiva's arrow, He shot his head off. ||1||Pause|| 714 : 103 Death, and the noose of death, cannot see me; I have adopted the Path of Truth. 714 : 104 14

I have earned the wealth, the jewel of the Lord's Name; eating and spending, it is never used up. ||1|| 714 : 105 In an instant, the slanderer was reduced to ashes; he received the rewards of his own actions. 714 : 106 Servant Nanak speaks the truth of the scriptures; the whole world is witness to it. ||2||6||11|| 714 : 107 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 714 : 108 O miser, your body and mind are full of sin. 714 : 109 In the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, vibrate, meditate on the Lord and Master; He alone can cover your sins. ||1||Pause|| 714 : 110 When many holes appear in your boat, you cannot plug them with your hands. 714 : 111 Worship and adore the One, to whom your boat belongs; He saves the counterfeit along with the genuine. ||1|| 714 : 112 People want to lift up the mountain with mere words, but it just stays there. 714 : 113 Raag Todee − Part 004 15

Nanak has no strength or power at all; O God, please protect me − I seek Your Sanctuary. ||2||7||12|| 714 : 114 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 714 : 115 Meditate on the lotus feet of the Lord within your mind. 714 : 116 The Name of the Lord is the medicine; it is like an axe, which destroys the diseases caused by anger and egotism. ||1||Pause|| 714 : 117 The Lord is the One who removes the three fevers; He is the Destroyer of pain, the warehouse of peace. 714 : 118 No obstacles block the path of one who prays before God. ||1|| 714 : 119 By the Grace of the Saints, the Lord has become my physician; God alone is the Doer, the Cause of causes. 714 : 120 He is the Giver of perfect peace to the innocent−minded people; O Nanak, the Lord, Har, Har, is my support. ||2||8||13|| 714 : 121 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 714 : 122 Raag Todee − Part 004 16

Chant the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, forever and ever. 714 : 123 Showering His Kind Mercy, the Supreme Lord God Himself has blessed the town. ||1||Pause|| 714 : 124 The One who owns me, has again taken care of me; my sorrow and suffering is past. 714 : 125 He gave me His hand, and saved me, His humble servant; the Lord is my mother and father. ||1|| 714 : 126 All beings and creatures have become kind to me; my Lord and Master blessed me with His Kind Mercy. 714 : 127 Nanak seeks the Sanctuary of the Lord, the Destroyer of pain; His glory is so great! ||2||9||14|| 714 : 128 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 714 : 129 O Lord and Master, I seek the Sanctuary of Your Court. 714 : 130 Destroyer of millions of sins, O Great Giver, other than You, who else can save me? ||1||Pause|| 714 : 131 Raag Todee − Part 004 17

Searching, searching in so many ways, I have contemplated all the objects of life. 714 : 132 In the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, the supreme state is attained. But those who are engrossed in the bondage of Maya, lose the game of life. ||1|| −− Raag Todee − Part 004 −− Raag Todee − Part 004 18

Raag Todee − Part 005 715 : 133 My mind is in love with the Lord's lotus feet; I have met the Beloved Guru, the noble, heroic being. 715 : 134 Nanak celebrates in bliss; chanting and meditating on the Lord, all sickness has been cured. ||2||10||15|| 715 : 135 Todee, Fifth Mehl, Third House, Chau−Padas: 715 : 136 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 715 : 137 Oh! Oh! You cling to Maya, you fool; this is not a trivial matter. 715 : 138 That which you consider to be yours, is not yours. ||Pause|| 715 : 139 You do not remember your Lord, even for an instant. 715 : 140 That which belongs to others, you believe to be your own. ||1|| 715 : 141 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is always with you, but you do not enshrine it within your 19

mind. 715 : 142 You have attached your consciousness to that which you must eventually abandon. ||2|| 715 : 143 You collect that which will bring you only hunger and thirst. 715 : 144 You have not obtained the supplies of the Ambrosial Naam. ||3|| 715 : 145 You have fallen into the pit of sexual desire, anger and emotional attachment. 715 : 146 By Guru's Grace, O Nanak, a rare few are saved. ||4||1||16|| 715 : 147 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 715 : 148 I have only the One Lord, my God. 715 : 149 I do not recognize any other. ||Pause|| 715 : 150 By great good fortune, I have found my Guru. 715 : 151 Raag Todee − Part 005 20

The Guru has implanted the Name of the Lord within me. ||1|| 715 : 152 The Name of the Lord, Har, Har, is my meditation, austerity, fasting and daily religious practice. 715 : 153 Meditating on the Lord, Har, Har, I have found total joy and bliss. ||2|| 715 : 154 The Praises of the Lord are my good conduct, occupation and social class. 715 : 155 Listening to the Kirtan of the Lord's Praises, I am in absolute ecstasy. ||3|| 715 : 156 Says Nanak, everything comes to the homes of those who have found their Lord and Master. ||4||2||17|| 715 : 157 Todee, Fifth Mehl, Fourth House, Du−Padas: 715 : 158 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 715 : 159 My beautiful mind longs for the Love of the Lord. 715 : 160 By mere words, the Lord's Love does not come. ||Pause|| Raag Todee − Part 005 21

715 : 161 I have searched for the Blessed Vision of His Darshan, looking in each and every street. 715 : 162 Meeting with the Guru, my doubts have been dispelled. ||1|| 715 : 163 I have obtained this wisdom from the Holy Saints, according to the pre−ordained destiny inscribed upon my forehead. 715 : 164 In this way, Nanak has seen the Lord with his eyes. ||2||1||18|| 715 : 165 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 715 : 166 My foolish heart is in the grip of pride. 715 : 167 By the Will of my Lord God, Maya, like a witch, has swallowed my soul. ||Pause|| 715 : 168 More and more, he continually yearns for more; but unless he is destined to receive, how can he obtain it? 715 : 169 He is entangled in wealth, bestowed by the Lord God; the unfortunate one attaches himself to the fire of desires. ||1|| 715 : 170 Raag Todee − Part 005 22

Listen, O mind, to the Teachings of the Holy Saints, and all your sins shall be totally washed away. 715 : 171 One who is destined to receive from the Lord, O servant Nanak, shall not be cast into the womb of reincarnation again. ||2||2||19|| −− Raag Todee − Part 005 −− Raag Todee − Part 005 23

Raag Todee − Part 006 716 : 172 Todee, Fifth Mehl, Fifth House, Du−Padas: 716 : 173 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 716 : 174 Such is the blessing my God has bestowed upon me. 716 : 175 He has totally banished the five evils and the illness of egotism from my body. ||Pause|| 716 : 176 Breaking my bonds, and releasing me from vice and corruption, He has enshrined the Word of the Guru's Shabad within my heart. 716 : 177 The Lord has not considered my beauty or ugliness; instead, He has held me with love. I am drenched with His Love. ||1|| 716 : 178 I behold my Beloved, now that the curtain has been torn away. My mind is happy, pleased and satisfied. 716 : 179 My house is His; He is my God. Nanak is obedient to His Lord and Master. ||2||1||20|| 716 : 180 24

Todee, Fifth Mehl: 716 : 181 O my mother, my mind is in love. 716 : 182 This is my karma and my Dharma; this is my meditation. The Lord's Name is my immaculate, unstained way of life. ||Pause|| 716 : 183 The Support of my breath of life, the wealth of my life, is to gaze upon the Blessed Vision of God's Darshan. 716 : 184 On the road, and on the river, these supplies are always with me. I have made my mind the Lord's companion. ||1|| 716 : 185 By the Grace of the Saints, my mind has become immaculate and pure. In His mercy, He has made me His own. 716 : 186 Remembering, remembering Him in meditation, Nanak has found peace. From the very beginning, and throughout the ages, He is the friend of His devotees. ||2||2||21|| 716 : 187 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 716 : 188 Dear God, please meet me; You are my breath of life. 716 : 189 Raag Todee − Part 006 25

Do not let me forget You from my heart, even for an instant; please, bless Your devotee with Your gift of perfection. ||Pause|| 716 : 190 Dispel my doubt, and save me, O my Beloved, all−knowing Lord, O Inner−knower, O Searcher of hearts. 716 : 191 The wealth of the Naam is worth millions of kingdoms to me; O God, please bless me with Your Ambrosial Glance of Grace. ||1|| 716 : 192 Twenty−four hours a day, I sing Your Glorious Praises. They totally satisfy my ears, O my all−powerful Lord. 716 : 193 I seek Your Sanctuary, O Lord, O Giver of life to the soul; forever and ever, Nanak is a sacrifice to You. ||2||3||22|| 716 : 194 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 716 : 195 O God, I am the dust of Your feet. 716 : 196 O merciful to the meek, Beloved mind−enticing Lord, by Your Kind Mercy, please fulfill my yearning. ||Pause|| 716 : 197 In the ten directions, Your Praises are permeating and pervading, O Inner−knower, Searcher of hearts, O Lord ever−present. Raag Todee − Part 006 26

716 : 198 Those who sing Your Praises, O Creator Lord, those humble beings never die or grieve. ||1|| 716 : 199 The worldly affairs and entanglements of Maya disappear, in the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy; all sorrows are taken away. 716 : 200 The comforts of wealth and the enjoyments of the soul − O Nanak, without the Lord, know them to be false. ||2||4||23|| 716 : 201 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 716 : 202 O my mother, my mind is so thirsty. 716 : 203 I cannot survive, even for an instant, without my Beloved. My mind is filled with the desire to behold the Blessed Vision of His Darshan. ||Pause|| 716 : 204 I meditate in remembrance on the Naam, the Name of the immaculate Creator Lord; all the sins and errors of my mind and body are washed away. 716 : 205 The Perfect Supreme Lord God, the eternal, imperishable Giver of peace − spotless and pure are His Praises. ||1|| 716 : 206 Raag Todee − Part 006 27
By the Grace of the Saints, my desires have been fulfilled; in His Mercy, the Lord, the treasure of virtue, has met me. −− Raag Todee − Part 006 −− Raag Todee − Part 006 28

Raag Todee − Part 007 717 : 207 Peace and tranquility, poise and pleasure, have welled up within my mind; millions of suns, O Nanak, illuminate me. ||2||5||24|| 717 : 208 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 717 : 209 The Lord, Har, Har, is the Purifier of sinners; 717 : 210 He is the soul, the breath of life, the Giver of peace and honor, the Inner−knower, the Searcher of hearts; He is pleasing to my mind. ||Pause|| 717 : 211 He is beautiful and wise, clever and all−knowing. He dwells within the hearts of His slaves; His devotees sing His Glorious Praises. 717 : 212 His form is immaculate and pure; He is the incomparable Lord and Master. Upon the field of actions and karma, whatever one plants, one eats. ||1|| 717 : 213 I am amazed, and wonder−struck by His wonder. There is none other than Him. 717 : 214 Meditating in remembrance on His Praises with my tongue, I live; slave Nanak is forever a sacrifice to Him. ||2||6||25|| 29

717 : 215 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 717 : 216 O my mother, Maya is so misleading and deceptive. 717 : 217 Without meditating on the Lord of the Universe, it is like straw on fire, or the shadow of a cloud, or the running of the flood−waters. ||Pause|| 717 : 218 Renounce your cleverness and all your mental tricks; with your palms pressed together, walk on the Path of the Holy Saints. 717 : 219 Remember the Lord, the Inner−knower, the Searcher of hearts; this is the most sublime reward of this human incarnation. ||1|| 717 : 220 The Holy Saints preach the teachings of the Vedas, but the unfortunate fools do not understand them. 717 : 221 Servant Nanak is absorbed in loving devotional worship; meditating in remembrance on the Lord, one's dirt is burnt away. ||2||7||26|| 717 : 222 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 717 : 223 O mother, the Guru's feet are so sweet. Raag Todee − Part 007 30

717 : 224 By great good fortune, the Transcendent Lord has blessed me with them. Millions of rewards come from the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan. ||Pause|| 717 : 225 Singing the Glorious Praises of the imperishable, indestructible Lord, sexual desire, anger and stubborn pride vanish. 717 : 226 Those who are imbued with the Love of the True Lord become permanent and eternal; birth and death do not grind them down any more. ||1|| 717 : 227 Without the Lord's meditation, all joys and pleasures are totally false and worthless; by the Kind Mercy of the Saints, I know this. 717 : 228 Servant Nanak has found the jewel of the Naam; without the Naam, all must depart, cheated and plundered. ||2||8||27|| 717 : 229 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 717 : 230 In the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, I contemplate the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 717 : 231 I am in peaceful poise and bliss, day and night; the seed of my destiny has sprouted. ||Pause|| 717 : 232 Raag Todee − Part 007 31

I have met the True Guru, by great good fortune; He has no end or limitation. 717 : 233 Taking His humble servant by the hand, He pulls him out of the poisonous world−ocean. ||1|| 717 : 234 Birth and death are ended for me, by the Word of the Guru's Teachings; I shall no longer pass through the door of pain and suffering. 717 : 235 Nanak holds tight to the Sanctuary of his Lord and Master; again and again, he bows in humility and reverence to Him. ||2||9||28|| 717 : 236 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 717 : 237 O my mother, my mind is at peace. 717 : 238 I enjoy the ecstasy of millions of princely pleasures; remembering the Lord in meditation, all pains have been dispelled. ||1||Pause|| 717 : 239 The sins of millions of lifetimes are erased, by meditating on the Lord; becoming pure, my mind and body have found peace. 717 : 240 Gazing upon the Lord's form of perfect beauty, my hopes have been fulfilled; attaining the Blessed Vision of His Darshan, my hunger has been appeased. ||1|| Raag Todee − Part 007 32

717 : 241 The four great blessings, the eight supernatural spiritual powers of the Siddhas, the wish−fulfilling Elysian cow, and the wish−fulfilling tree of life − all these come from the Lord, Har, Har. 717 : 242 O Nanak, holding tight to the Sanctuary of the Lord, the ocean of peace, you shall not suffer the pains of birth and death, or fall into the womb of reincarnation again. ||2||10||29|| −− Raag Todee − Part 007 −− Raag Todee − Part 007 33

Raag Todee − Part 008 718 : 243 Todee, Fifth Mehl: 718 : 244 I have enshrined the Lord's Feet within my heart. 718 : 245 Contemplating my Lord and Master, my True Guru, all my affairs have been resolved. ||1||Pause|| 718 : 246 The merits of giving donations to charity and devotional worship come from the Kirtan of the Praises of the Transcendent Lord; this is the true essence of wisdom. 718 : 247 Singing the Praises of the unapproachable, infinite Lord and Master, I have found immeasurable peace. ||1|| 718 : 248 The Supreme Lord God does not consider the merits and demerits of those humble beings whom He makes His own. 718 : 249 Hearing, chanting and meditating on the jewel of the Naam, I live; Nanak wears the Lord as his necklace. ||2||11||30|| 718 : 250 Todee, Ninth Mehl: 34

718 : 251 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 718 : 252 What can I say about my base nature? 718 : 253 I am entangled in the love of gold and women, and I have not sung the Kirtan of God's Praises. ||1||Pause|| 718 : 254 I judge the false world to be true, and I have fallen in love with it. 718 : 255 I have never contemplated the friend of the poor, who shall be my companion and helper in the end. ||1|| 718 : 256 I remain intoxicated by Maya, night and day, and the filth of my mind will not depart. 718 : 257 Says Nanak, now, without the Lord's Sanctuary, I cannot find salvation in any other way. ||2||1||31|| 718 : 258 Todee, The Word Of The Devotees: 718 : 259 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 718 : 260 Raag Todee − Part 008 35

Some say that He is near, and others say that He is far away. 718 : 261 We might just as well say that the fish climbs out of the water, up the tree. ||1|| 718 : 262 Why do you speak such nonsense? 718 : 263 One who has found the Lord, keeps quiet about it. ||1||Pause|| 718 : 264 Those who become Pandits, religious scholars, recite the Vedas, 718 : 265 but foolish Naam Dayv knows only the Lord. ||2||1|| 718 : 266 Whose blemishes remain, when one chants the Lord's Name? 718 : 267 Sinners become pure, chanting the Lord's Name. ||1||Pause|| 718 : 268 With the Lord, servant Naam Dayv has come to have faith. 718 : 269 I have stopped fasting on the eleventh day of each month; why should I bother to go on pilgrimages to sacred shrines? ||1|| Raag Todee − Part 008 36

718 : 270 Prays Naam Dayv, I have become a man of good deeds and good thoughts. 718 : 271 Chanting the Lord's Name, under Guru's Instructions, who has not gone to heaven? ||2||2|| 718 : 272 Here is a verse with a three−fold play on words. ||1||Pause|| 718 : 273 In the potter's home there are pots, and in the king's home there are camels. 718 : 274 In the Brahmin's home there are widows. So here they are: haandee, saandee, raandee. ||1|| 718 : 275 In the home of the grocer there is asafoetida; on the forehead of the buffalo there are horns. 718 : 276 In the temple of Shiva there are lingams. So here they are: heeng, seeng, leeng. ||2|| 718 : 277 In the house of the oil−presser there is oil; in the forest there are vines. 718 : 278 In the gardener's home there are bananas. So here they are: tayl, bayl, kayl. ||3|| 718 : 279 The Lord of the Universe, Govind, is within His Saints; Krishna, Shyaam, is in Gokal. Raag Todee − Part 008 37
718 : 280 The Lord, Raam, is in Naam Dayv. So here they are: Raam, Shyaam, Govind. ||4||3|| −− Raag Todee −− Raag Todee − Part 008 38
